verbs.description: befeather (third-person singular simple present befeathers, present participle befeathering, simple past and past participle befeathered)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To deck or cover with feathers.
examples: The men were not ill made, but they disfigured themselves with grease and coarse paint; they were of a dark copper-colour, with lank black hair, which they tied in a knot behind; but they so bepowdered, or rather befeathered it with down, that the colour was hardly discernible  […]
